Articles.Content:
So I thaught I could make a quick buck by mining ore and recover it...

Turns out 300 ore = 6 funds.

Now that's not fair is it ? ? ?
You could get more funds for refining it into LF, Ox, and/or Monoprop, no?

Ore is more "pricey" when you convert it into mono, LF, and OX, however that would kinda require some in game days and a huge electric charge storage with solar panels. I would not really recommend this but as a last resort for money. Missions offer way more.

Well that is fair. Not processed materials are always cheaper than resources made from it. It's not even a law of physics, it's pure business. You need time to make something useful, and you probably want something in exchange for that time.
Totally not fair. That guy paid you 6 funds for dirt he could have dug up his own self.

You guys have a point, I do believe monoprop will give me the most value ?

Back to the drawing board.

I suppose homemade Ore, Lf, Ox or Monoprop once back to Kerbin really only have curiosity value.  There will be a mine/factory that can make it cheaper and better than our dinky little drills and processor.  Real value is when it's still in orbit!  Then a single tank is worth the cost of the tank, the contents and the cost of the whole rocket to get it up there in the first place!

14 hours ago, Triop said:

You guys have a point, I do believe monoprop will give me the most value ?

Yes.
